POST.description: The New Session command creates a new WebDriver session with the endpoint node. If the creation fails, a session not created error is returned.

parameters.name: capabilities
parameters.description: a JSON object, the set of capabilities that was ultimately merged and matched in the capability processing algorithm

returns.name: session
returns.description: Object containing sessionId and capabilities of created WebDriver session.

DELETE.description: The Delete Session command closes any top-level browsing contexts associated with the current session, terminates the connection, and finally closes the current session.

GET.description: The Status command returns information about whether a remote end is in a state in which it can create new sessions and can additionally include arbitrary meta information that is specific to the implementation.

returns.name: status
returns.description: Object containing status of the driver status.

GET.description: The Get Timeouts command gets timeout durations associated with the current session.

returns.name: timeouts
returns.description: Object containing timeout durations for `script`, `pageLoad` and `implicit` timeouts.

POST.description: The Set Timeouts command sets timeout durations associated with the current session. The timeouts that can be controlled are listed in the table of session timeouts below.

parameters.name: implicit
parameters.description: integer in ms for session implicit wait timeout

parameters.name: pageLoad
parameters.description: integer in ms for session page load timeout

parameters.name: script
parameters.description: integer in ms for session script timeout

GET.description: The Get Current URL command returns the URL of the current top-level browsing context.

returns.name: url
returns.description: current top-level browsing context’s active document’s document URL

POST.description: The navigateTo (go) command is used to cause the user agent to navigate the current top-level browsing context a new location.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: string representing an absolute URL (beginning with http(s)), possibly including a fragment (#...), could also be a local scheme (about: etc)

returns.name: url
returns.description: current document URL of the top-level browsing context.

POST.description: The Back command causes the browser to traverse one step backward in the joint session history of the current top-level browsing context. This is equivalent to pressing the back button in the browser chrome or calling `window.history.back`.
The Forward command causes the browser to traverse one step forwards in the joint session history of the current top-level browsing context.
The Refresh command causes the browser to reload the page in current top-level browsing context.

GET.description: The Get Title command returns the document title of the current top-level browsing context, equivalent to calling `document.title`.

returns.name: title
returns.description: Returns a string which is the same as `document.title` of the current top-level browsing context.

GET.description: The Get Window Handle command returns the window handle for the current top-level browsing context. It can be used as an argument to Switch To Window.

returns.name: handle
returns.description: Returns a string which is the window handle for the current top-level browsing context.

DELETE.description: The Close Window command closes the current top-level browsing context. Once done, if there are no more top-level browsing contexts open, the WebDriver session itself is closed.

POST.description: The Switch To Window command is used to select the current top-level browsing context for the current session, i.e. the one that will be used for processing commands.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: a string representing a window handle, should be one of the strings that was returned in a call to getWindowHandles

POST.description: Create a new top-level browsing context.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Set to 'tab' if the newly created window shares an OS-level window with the current browsing context, or 'window' otherwise.

returns.name: window
returns.description: New window object containing 'handle' with the value of the handle and 'type' with the value of the created window type

GET.description: The Get Window Handles command returns a list of window handles for every open top-level browsing context. The order in which the window handles are returned is arbitrary.

returns.name: handles
returns.description: An array which is a list of window handles.

POST.description: The Print Page command renders the document to a paginated PDF document.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: page orientation. Default: `portrait`

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: page scale. Default: `1`

parameters.name: background
parameters.description: page background. Default: `false`

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: page width in cm. Default: `21.59` from page

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: page height in cm. Default: `27.94` from page

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: page margin in cm from top margin. Default: `1`

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.description: page margin in cm from bottom margin. Default: `1`

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: page margin in cm from left margin. Default: `1`

parameters.name: right
parameters.description: page margin in cm from right margin. Default: `1`

parameters.name: shrinkToFit
parameters.description: shrink pdf to fit in page. Default: `true`

parameters.name: pageRanges
parameters.description: page ranges. Default `[]`

returns.name: pdf
returns.description: The base64-encoded PDF representation of the paginated document.

POST.description: The Switch To Frame command is used to select the current top-level browsing context or a child browsing context of the current browsing context to use as the current browsing context for subsequent commands.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: one of three possible types: null: this represents the top-level browsing context (i.e., not an iframe), a Number, representing the index of the window object corresponding to a frame, an Element object received using `findElement`.

POST.description: The Switch to Parent Frame command sets the current browsing context for future commands to the parent of the current browsing context.

GET.description: The Get Window Rect command returns the size and position on the screen of the operating system window corresponding to the current top-level browsing context.

returns.name: windowRect
returns.description: A JSON representation of a "window rect" object. This has 4 properties: `x`, `y`, `width` and `height`.

POST.description: The Set Window Rect command alters the size and the position of the operating system window corresponding to the current top-level browsing context.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the screenX attribute of the window object

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the screenY attribute of the window object

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: the width of the outer dimensions of the top-level browsing context, including browser chrome etc...

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: the height of the outer dimensions of the top-level browsing context, including browser chrome etc...

returns.name: windowRect
returns.description: A JSON representation of a "window rect" object based on the new window state.

POST.description: The Maximize Window command invokes the window manager-specific "maximize" operation, if any, on the window containing the current top-level browsing context. This typically increases the window to the maximum available size without going full-screen.

returns.name: windowRect
returns.description: A JSON representation of a "window rect" object based on the new window state.

POST.description: The Minimize Window command invokes the window manager-specific "minimize" operation, if any, on the window containing the current top-level browsing context. This typically hides the window in the system tray.

returns.name: windowRect
returns.description: A JSON representation of a "window rect" object of the (new) current top-level browsing context.

POST.description: The Fullscreen Window command invokes the window manager-specific “full screen” operation, if any, on the window containing the current top-level browsing context. This typically increases the window to the size of the physical display and can hide browser chrome elements such as toolbars.

returns.name: windowRect
returns.description: A JSON representation of a "window rect" object of the (new) current top-level browsing context.

POST.description: The Find Element command is used to find an element in the current browsing context that can be used for future commands. This command returns JSON representation of the element that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element.

parameters.name: using
parameters.description: a valid element location strategy

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the actual selector that will be used to find an element

returns.name: element
returns.description: A JSON representation of an element object, e.g. `{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }`.

POST.description: The Find Element From Shadow Root command is used to find an element within the shadow root of an element that can be used for future commands. This command returns JSON representation of the element that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element.
examples: // fetch element within that shadow root

variables.name: shadowId
variables.description: element id of a shadow root element

parameters.name: using
parameters.description: a valid element location strategy

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the actual selector that will be used to find an element

returns.name: element
returns.description: A JSON representation of an element shadow object, e.g. `{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }`.

POST.description: The Find Elements command is used to find elements in the current browsing context that can be used for future commands. This command returns array of JSON representation of the elements that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element (See findElement).

parameters.name: using
parameters.description: a valid element location strategy

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the actual selector that will be used to find an element

returns.name: elements
returns.description: A (possibly empty) JSON list of representations of an element object, e.g. `[{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }]`.

POST.description: The Find Elements command is used to find elements within the shadow root of an element that can be used for future commands. This command returns array of JSON representation of the elements that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element (See findElement).

variables.name: shadowId
variables.description: element id of a shadow root element

parameters.name: using
parameters.description: a valid element location strategy

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the actual selector that will be used to find an element

examples: // fetch elements within that shadow root

returns.name: elements
returns.description: A (possibly empty) JSON list of representations of an element object, e.g. `{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }`.

POST.description: The Find Element From Element command is used to find an element from a web element in the current browsing context that can be used for future commands. This command returns JSON representation of the element that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element (See findElement).

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

parameters.name: using
parameters.description: a valid element location strategy

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the actual selector that will be used to find an element

returns.name: element
returns.description: A JSON representation of an element object, e.g. `{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }`.

POST.description: The Find Elements From Element command is used to find elements from a web element in the current browsing context that can be used for future commands. This command returns array of JSON representation of the elements that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element (See findElement).

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

parameters.name: using
parameters.description: a valid element location strategy

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the actual selector that will be used to find an element

returns.name: elements
returns.description: A (possibly empty) JSON list of representations of an element object, e.g. `[{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }]`.

GET.description: Get the shadow root object of an element. The result object can be used to fetch elements within this shadow root using e.g. findElementFromShadowRoots or findElementsFromShadowRoots.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: element
returns.description: A JSON representation of an element shadow root, e.g. `{ 'shadow-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }`.

GET.description: Get Active Element returns the active element of the current browsing context’s document element. This command returns JSON representation of the element that can be passed to $ command to transform the reference to an extended WebdriverIO element (See findElement).

returns.name: element
returns.description: A JSON representation of an element object, e.g. `{ 'element-6066-11e4-a52e-4f735466cecf': 'ELEMENT_1' }`.

GET.description: Is Element Selected determines if the referenced element is selected or not. This operation only makes sense on input elements of the Checkbox- and Radio Button states, or option elements.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: isSelected
returns.description: `true` or `false` based on the selected state.

GET.description: Is Element Displayed determines the visibility of an element which is guided by what is perceptually visible to the human eye. In this context, an element's displayedness does not relate to the `visibility` or `display` style properties.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: isDisplayed
returns.description: `true` or `false` based on the visible state.

GET.description: The Get Element Attribute command will return the attribute of a web element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

variables.name: name
variables.description: name of the attribute value to retrieve

returns.name: attribute
returns.description: The named attribute of the element.

GET.description: The Get Element Property command will return the result of getting a property of an element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

variables.name: name
variables.description: name of the attribute property to retrieve

returns.name: property
returns.description: The named property of the element, accessed by calling GetOwnProperty on the element object.

GET.description: The Get Element CSS Value command retrieves the computed value of the given CSS property of the given web element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

variables.name: propertyName
variables.description: name of the CSS property to retrieve

returns.name: cssValue
returns.description: The computed value of the parameter corresponding to property name from the element's style declarations (unless the document type is xml, in which case the return value is simply the empty string).

GET.description: The Get Element Text command intends to return an element’s text "as rendered". An element's rendered text is also used for locating a elements by their link text and partial link text.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: text
returns.description: The visible text of the element (including child elements), following the algorithm defined in the Selenium Atoms for [`bot.dom.getVisibleText`](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/e09e28f016c9f53196cf68d6f71991c5af4a35d4/javascript/atoms/dom.js#L981).

GET.description: The Get Element Tag Name command returns the qualified element name of the given web element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: text
returns.description: The tagName attribute of the element.

GET.description: The Get Element Rect command returns the dimensions and coordinates of the given web element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: elementRect
returns.description: A JSON object representing the position and bounding rect of the element.

GET.description: Is Element Enabled determines if the referenced element is enabled or not. This operation only makes sense on form controls.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: isEnabled
returns.description: If the element is in an xml document, or is a disabled form control: `false`, otherwise, `true`.

POST.description: The Element Click command scrolls into view the element if it is not already pointer-interactable, and clicks its in-view center point. If the element's center point is obscured by another element, an element click intercepted error is returned. If the element is outside the viewport, an element not interactable error is returned.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

POST.description: The Element Clear command scrolls into view an editable or resettable element and then attempts to clear its selected files or text content.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

POST.description:
The Element Send Keys command scrolls into view the form control element and then sends the provided keys to the element. In case the element is not keyboard-interactable, an element not interactable error is returned.

The key input state used for input may be cleared mid-way through "typing" by sending the null key, which is U+E000 (NULL).

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: string to send as keystrokes to the element

GET.description: The Get Page Source command returns a string serialization of the DOM of the current browsing context active document.

returns.name: pageSource
returns.description: the DOM of the current browsing context active document

POST.description: The Execute Script command executes a JavaScript function in the context of the current browsing context and returns the return value of the function.

parameters.name: script
parameters.description: a string, the Javascript function body you want executed

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: an array of JSON values which will be deserialized and passed as arguments to your function

returns.name: result
returns.description: Either the return value of your script, the fulfillment of the Promise returned by your script, or the error which was the reason for your script's returned Promise's rejection.

POST.description: The Execute Async Script command causes JavaScript to execute as an anonymous function. Unlike the Execute Script command, the result of the function is ignored. Instead an additional argument is provided as the final argument to the function. This is a function that, when called, returns its first argument as the response.

parameters.name: script
parameters.description: a string, the Javascript function body you want executed

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: an array of JSON values which will be deserialized and passed as arguments to your function

returns.name: result
returns.description: Either the return value of your script, the fulfillment of the Promise returned by your script, or the error which was the reason for your script's returned Promise's rejection.

GET.description: The Get All Cookies command returns all cookies associated with the address of the current browsing context’s active document.

returns.name: cookies
returns.description: A list of serialized cookies. Each serialized cookie has a number of optional fields which may or may not be returned in addition to `name` and `value`.

POST.description: The Add Cookie command adds a single cookie to the cookie store associated with the active document's address.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: A JSON object representing a cookie. It must have at least the name and value fields and could have more, including expiry-time and so on

DELETE.description: The Delete All Cookies command allows deletion of all cookies associated with the active document's address.

GET.description: The Get Named Cookie command returns the cookie with the requested name from the associated cookies in the cookie store of the current browsing context's active document. If no cookie is found, a no such cookie error is returned.

variables.name: name
variables.description: name of the cookie to retrieve

returns.name: cookie
returns.description: A serialized cookie, with name and value fields. There are a number of optional fields like `path`, `domain`, and `expiry-time` which may also be present.

DELETE.description: The Delete Cookie command allows you to delete either a single cookie by parameter name, or all the cookies associated with the active document's address if name is undefined.

variables.name: name
variables.description: name of the cookie to delete

POST.description: The Perform Actions command is used to execute complex user actions. See [spec](https://github.com/jlipps/simple-wd-spec#perform-actions) for more details.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: a list of objects, each of which represents an input source and its associated actions

DELETE.description: The Release Actions command is used to release all the keys and pointer buttons that are currently depressed. This causes events to be fired as if the state was released by an explicit series of actions. It also clears all the internal state of the virtual devices.

POST.description: The Dismiss Alert command dismisses a simple dialog if present, otherwise error. A request to dismiss an alert user prompt, which may not necessarily have a dismiss button, has the same effect as accepting it.
The Accept Alert command accepts a simple dialog if present, otherwise error.

GET.description: The Get Alert Text command returns the message of the current user prompt. If there is no current user prompt, it returns an error.

returns.name: alertText
returns.description: The message of the user prompt.

POST.description: The Send Alert Text command sets the text field of a window.prompt user prompt to the given value.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: string to set the prompt to

GET.description: The Take Screenshot command takes a screenshot of the top-level browsing context's viewport.

returns.name: screenshot
returns.description: The base64-encoded PNG image data comprising the screenshot of the initial viewport.

GET.description: The Take Element Screenshot command takes a screenshot of the visible region encompassed by the bounding rectangle of an element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

parameters.name: scroll
parameters.description: scroll into view the element. Default: true

returns.name: screenshot
returns.description: The base64-encoded PNG image data comprising the screenshot of the visible region of an element’s bounding rectangle after it has been scrolled into view.

GET.description: Get the computed WAI-ARIA role of an element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: role
returns.description: The result of computing the WAI-ARIA role of element.

GET.description: Get the accessible name of the element.

variables.name: elementId
variables.description: the id of an element returned in a previous call to Find Element(s)

returns.name: label
returns.description: The result of a Accessible Name and Description Computation for the Accessible Name of the element.

POST.description: Simulates user modification of a PermissionDescriptor's permission state. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

parameters.name: descriptor
parameters.description: Each powerful feature has one or more aspects that websites can request permission to access. To describe these aspects, each feature defines a subtype of PermissionDescriptor to be its permission descriptor type. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Determines whether permission is granted, denied or prompted.

parameters.name: oneRealm
parameters.description: Whether or not to apply permissions to all execution contexts.

POST.description: Generates a report for testing. Extension for [Reporting API](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/09/reportingapi). __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the report.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Specifies the endpoint group to deliver the report to.

POST.description: Creates a mock sensor to emulate sensors like Ambient Light Sensor. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

parameters.name: mockSensorType
parameters.description: Type of sensor API to mock, e.g. 'ambient-light'

parameters.name: maxSamplingFrequency
parameters.description: A double representing frequency in Hz that is used to set maximum supported sampling frequency for the associated mock sensor.

parameters.name: minSamplingFrequency
parameters.description: A double representing frequency in Hz that is used to set minimum supported sampling frequency for the associated mock sensor.

GET.description: Retrieves information about a given type of mock sensor. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

variables.name: type
variables.description: Mock sensor type to retrieve information from.

returns.name: sensorReading
returns.description: Values of the mock sensor reading.

POST.description: Updates the mock sensor type. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

variables.name: type
variables.description: Mock sensor type to update information for.

parameters.name: mockSensorType
parameters.description: Type of sensor API to mock, e.g. 'ambient-light'

parameters.name: maxSamplingFrequency
parameters.description: A double representing frequency in Hz that is used to set maximum supported sampling frequency for the associated mock sensor.

parameters.name: minSamplingFrequency
parameters.description: A double representing frequency in Hz that is used to set minimum supported sampling frequency for the associated mock sensor.

DELETE.description: The Delete Session command closes any top-level browsing contexts associated with the current session, terminates the connection, and finally closes the current session. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

variables.name: type
variables.description: Mock sensor type to delete.

POST.description: Simulates the changing of a time zone for the purposes of testing. __Note:__ this feature has not landed in all browsers yet.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Name of the timezone, e.g. Asia/Tokyo

POST.description: Creates a software [Virtual Authenticator](https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn-2/#virtual-authenticators).

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: Valid values: 'ctap1/u2f', 'ctap2', 'ctap2_1'

parameters.name: transport
parameters.description: Valid values: 'usb', 'nfc', 'ble' or 'internal'

DELETE.description: Removes a previously created Virtual Authenticator.

variables.name: authenticatorId
variables.description: id of authenticator

POST.description: Injects a Public Key Credential Source into an existing Virtual Authenticator.

parameters.name: credentialId
parameters.description: The Credential ID encoded using Base64url Encoding.

parameters.name: isResidentCredential
parameters.description: If set to true, a client-side discoverable credential is created. If set to false, a server-side credential is created instead.

parameters.name: rpId
parameters.description: The Relying Party ID the credential is scoped to.

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: An asymmetric key package containing a single private key per [RFC5958], encoded using Base64url Encoding.

parameters.name: userHandle
parameters.description: The userHandle associated to the credential encoded using Base64url Encoding. This property may not be defined.

parameters.name: signCount
parameters.description: The initial value for a signature counter associated to the public key credential source.

parameters.name: largeBlob
parameters.description: The large, per-credential blob associated to the public key credential source, encoded using Base64url Encoding. This property may not be defined.

GET.description: Returns one Credential Parameters object for every Public Key Credential Source stored in a Virtual Authenticator, regardless of whether they were stored using Add Credential or `navigator.credentials.create()`.

variables.name: authenticatorId
variables.description: id of authenticator

DELETE.description: Removes all Public Key Credential Sources stored on a Virtual Authenticator.

variables.name: authenticatorId
variables.description: id of authenticator

DELETE.description: Removes a Public Key Credential Source stored on a Virtual Authenticator.

variables.name: authenticatorId
variables.description: id of authenticator

variables.name: credentialId
variables.description: id of credential

POST.description: The Set User Verified extension command sets the isUserVerified property on the Virtual Authenticator.

variables.name: authenticatorId
variables.description: id of authenticator

variables.name: credentialId
variables.description: id of credential
